# Status Badges for README

Add these badges to your README.md to show the build status:

## CI/CD Pipeline Status
```markdown
![CI/CD Pipeline](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO_NAME/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)
```

## Quick Tests Status  
```markdown
![Quick Tests](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO_NAME/actions/workflows/quick-test.yml/badge.svg)
```

## Example README Section
```markdown
# Trading Strategies System

![CI/CD Pipeline](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO_NAME/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)
![Quick Tests](https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO_NAME/actions/workflows/quick-test.yml/badge.svg)
![Python 3.9+](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.9+-blue.svg)

A comprehensive trading strategy system with automated testing and deployment.

## Features
- ✅ Automated testing on Python 3.9, 3.10, 3.11
- ✅ Code quality checks
- ✅ Security scanning
- ✅ Integration testing
- ✅ Automatic deployment artifacts
```

## How to Update
Replace `YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO_NAME` with your actual GitHub username and repository name.

For example: `johndoe/trading-strategies` would become:
```markdown
![CI/CD Pipeline](https://github.com/johndoe/trading-strategies/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)
```
